project_level: eDNA sampled by the NOAA Ship Okeanos Explorer (tentative)

Sampling bags were new, sterile WhirPaks. Single-use syringes and filters were used for filtration. Single-use gloves were used to collect and filter each sample. All tools sterilized with 10% bleach and 70% ethanol between handling filters.
Bacteria-16S-V4-EMP | Phytoplankton-18S-V4-Stoeck-Piredda | Fish-12S-MiFish-Miya | Metazoa-COI-Leray-Geller | Anthozoa-Scleractinia-28S-McCartin | Octocoral-mutS-Everett-Paragorgia

Anthozoa-Scleractinia-28S-McCartin: Includes subclasses Hexacorallia (including order Scleractina) and Octocorallia

project_level: Laboratories of Analytical Biology, National Museum of Natural History
Final library concentrations were quantified using QuBit or Quant-IT fluorometric assays. Library sizes were spot checked on an Agilent Tapestation High Sensitivity D1000 screentape.
